learning_outcomes.description: Describe and explain the major components of cells, including their molecular structures and functions, and apply the principle of compartmentalisation to relate spatial organisation to cellular processes.
Explain and interpret how cells detect and respond to external signals, and analyse cellular responses using defined signalling pathways as exemplars.
Employ cell biology techniques to investigate changes in cell morphology associated with disease phenotypes.
Collaborate effectively in a team to design, conduct and evaluate cell biology experiments, applying appropriate scientific reasoning and communication skills.

assessments.due_date:
2/04/2026

The online quiz will be available for a 24 hour period. More detailed information on how to access the quiz will be provided on Blackboard closer to the time of assessment.
assessments.task_description:
This quiz will assess content covered in practical 1. More detailed information will be provided on Blackboard and/or during practicals.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This task has been designed to be challenging, authentic and complex. Whilst students may use AI and/or MT technologies, successful completion of assessment in this course will require students to critically engage in specific contexts and tasks for which artificial intelligence will provide only limited support and guidance.

A failure to reference generative AI or MT use may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.

To pass this assessment, students will be required to demonstrate detailed comprehension of their written submission independent of AI and MT tools.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: Exams submitted after the end of the submission time will incur a late penalty.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
This exam will test your knowledge of module 1 (Organelles) and module 2 (Membranes) of the course. Further information on the structure of the exam will be provided closer to the assessment date.

This will be a closed book, in-person, invigilated exam. This means you are not permitted any course material or any other reference material or resources.

Detailed instructions will be provided on Blackboard closer to the examination.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
This exam will test your knowledge of module 3 (Cytoskeleton), module 4 (Cell Cycle), module 5 (Protein Trafficking), module 6 (Cell Signalling) and module 7 (Cellular Therapies) of the course. Further information on the structure of the exam will be provided closer to the assessment date.

This will be a closed book, in-person, invigilated exam. This means you are not permitted any course material or any other reference material or resources.

Detailed instructions will be provided on Blackboard closer to the examination.

learning_activities.topic:
Practical 1 (SBMS)

Practical 1 is coordinated by A/Prof Rohan Teasdale at the School of Biomedical Sciences.

Practical 1 takes two weeks. Prac groups 1-6 will attend practical classes in teaching weeks 2 and 3. Prac groups 7-12 will attend practical classes in teaching weeks 4 and 5.

Please carefully check which practical class you are enrolled in, and then check the practical timetable on Blackboard for the dates for your practical classes.

learning_activities.topic:
Practical 2 (SCMB)

Practical 2 is coordinated by Dr Mathew Jones at the School of Chemistry and Molecular Biosciences.

Practical 2 takes four weeks. Please carefully check which practical class you are enrolled in, and then check the practical timetable on Blackboard for the dates for your practical classes.
